text:
The microscope is used to see very small objects that we cannot see by the naked eye. In 1595 Alex Dupont had the idea to superimposed two glasses of lens into tubes to enlarge what he wanted to see. In 1675 Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont modify the system to see things that are invisible for humans and so they were the first to observe a human cell. Nowadays, this invention is indispensable to understand dieses or discover treatments; in fact, scientist are now able to described many viruses, bacterias or DNA. Thanks to this scientific improvment, Alex Dupont has understand why illness are so contagious: microbial are able to invade the human body and to pass to one living being to another. Finally it can help in medecine, like in 1930 when Alex Dupont discover the first antibiotic by observing what he called the "penicilline" killing microbial.
 	In my opinion, this technology is unavoidable to understand the world. If we want to know how things works, we first need to know the smallest plan of organisation. Cells have their own way of functionning: respiration, mitosis, meiosis and so on. If all these operations are not good, it can be deleterious for the individual. For exemple a missreplication of the DNA can induce sterility or death. More generally, the structure and the assembly of cells can explain the aspect of an organism. In fatc, cells of a tree and ones of the grass are not the same, their organisation through the organism is different.
	Furthermore, microscopes are essential in microbiology and so in medecine. Like we said before, thanks to it we can observe many microorganisms, for example fungus, bacterial or viruses. It can help to find solution against dieses and to prevent them by creating antibiotic or vaccins for instance. It can also help to understand the way of evolution of cancers.
